name: W. L. Newcomb, Justice of the Peace, Third District, Dade County, Florida, Plaintiff in Error, v. W. Cecil Watson, Chairman, and J. D. Redd, C. H. Crandon, Hugh Peters and R. P. Barfield, Members, constituting the Board of County Commissioners, in and for Dade County, Florida, Defendants in Error

judges: Terrell, C. J., and Whitfield, Strum and Brown, J. J., concur.
Ellis and Buford, J. J., dissent.
parties: W. L. Newcomb, Justice of the Peace, Third District, Dade County, Florida, Plaintiff in Error, v. W. Cecil Watson, Chairman, and J. D. Redd, C. H. Crandon, Hugh Peters and R. P. Barfield, Members, constituting the Board of County Commissioners, in and for Dade County, Florida, Defendants in Error.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam.
Affirmed on authority of State ex rel. Murphy, v. Harlee, et al., filed this day.
Terrell, C. J., and Whitfield, Strum and Brown, J. J., concur.
Ellis and Buford, J. J., dissent.
opinions.author: Per Curiam.

opinions.text:
Buford, J.,
(dissenting)—I dissent for reasons stated in opinion .prepared by me in Williams et al., v. State, filed at this term.
Ellis, J., concurs.
opinions.author: Buford, J.,

attorneys: Bart A. Riley, for Plaintiff in Error;
A. B. Small and Wallace Ruff, for Defendants in Error.
casebody.head_matter:
W. L. Newcomb, Justice of the Peace, Third District, Dade County, Florida, Plaintiff in Error, v. W. Cecil Watson, Chairman, and J. D. Redd, C. H. Crandon, Hugh Peters and R. P. Barfield, Members, constituting the Board of County Commissioners, in and for Dade County, Florida, Defendants in Error.
En Banc.
Decision filed December 20, 1930.
Bart A. Riley, for Plaintiff in Error;
A. B. Small and Wallace Ruff, for Defendants in Error.
